chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mayberto Huesca-Herrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mayberto Huesca-Herrera is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mayberto Huesca-Herrera was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence forthwith

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders that all court costs, DNA surcharge and $154 subpoena fees be paid from Bond money

--Sex offender treatment and follow-through with all recommendations
--Sex offender registration
--No possession of any "Smart Phone", computer or other computerized device capable of accessing the internet except as authorized by Agent in writing for purposes of employment or treatment
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--To pay restitution in an amount not to exceed $10,000, payable to VCS or her parents for counseling pursuant to 973.20(4m), Wis. Stats.
--No contact with VCS (d.o.b. 2/1/2000) or any female under the age of 18
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:14 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Mayberto Huesca-Herrera in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Court discusses Interpreter Needs for this hearing; Atty Benavides informs the Court that Mr. Huesca Herrera would like to use the interpreter for two phases today - to clarify any words as needed and for interpretation for his mother in making a statement. Victim Rights compliance verified
DA Happ indicates that Count #1-1st incident in the car had the same date range as Count #2 and since Count #2 covers all contacts, State moves to dismiss outright Count #1, presents further basis
No objection from Atty Benavides - Court grants, reopens and dismiss Count #1 outright.
Sentencing Arguments by DA Happ; Statement by Astoria Herrera Flores; Sentencing Arguments by Atty Benavides

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Huesca-Herrera to 10 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 4 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 45 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Sex offender treatment and follow-through with all recommendations
--Sex offender registration
--No possession of any "Smart Phone", computer or other computerized device capable of accessing the internet except as authorized by Agent in writing for purposes of employment or treatment
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--To pay restitution in an amount not to exceed $10,000, payable to VCS or her parents for counseling pursuant to 973.20(4m), Wis. Stats.
--No contact with VCS (d.o.b. 2/1/2000) or any female under the age of 18
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Court orders that all court costs, DNA surcharge and $154 subpoena fees be paid from Bond money and all remaining bond be returned to surety
Atty Benavides submits custody credit worksheet

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 3:11 pm
Letter submitted by Victim
14 letters on behalf of the defendant submitted by Attoreny Benavides
2 Letters of support submitted by Attorney Benavides
Sentencing hearing at 09-14-2015 02:00 pm
with criminal case settlement & elements
Scheduling Notice

As Court is reviewing plea questionnaire; Mr. Huesca-Herrera requests that the interpreter be put on "stand-by" but remain in case he has any questions - Court grants upon agreement of Counsel

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Case called at 8:41 am [Clerk SH] (On Motion to Determine Admissibility of Certain Evidence)
Defendant Mayberto Huesca-Herrera in court, in-custody, with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.

Upon questioning of the Court; DA Happ indicates that they do not intend to introduce evidence of victim's cond. at trial; opposed to motion
Atty Benavides: filed motion before State's MIL - clarifies & presents arguments
Court clarifies that any activity btwn. the Def. & victim is admissible.
Arguments presented re: prior conduct & reputation
Atty Benavides orally motions to voir dire victim outside presence of jury
DA Happ informs parties that a supplemental report could be provided from interview to avoid hearing; presents basis
Atty Benavides - Agreed - but if do need to interview victim; will attempt to work with DA Happ to follow-up in least disruptive way
Court indicates that after the interview if: State's satisifed that prior allegations with Pineda are true and if the defense doesn't accept the State's position on that then the Court would be willing to consider allowing the defense to voir dire the victim outside the presence of the jury but on the same day of the jury trial.

Court determines that the evidence concerning the victim's conduct with Pineda is barred by the Rape Shield statute 972.11. Willing to reconsider this issue if the defense believes it has new evidence determining the alleged statements of sexual contact with Pineda are untruthful. B2 does not apply, exception under 2 does not apply, 3 does not warrant introduction of evidence as defense seeks.  

Arguments presented under - 906.07  & 906.08
Court concludes that the same analysis that applies under 972.11 would also apply under 906.07 & 906.08; this does not provide a separate additional avenue for the defense to introduce evidence of the victim's prior sexual conduct that is prohibited under 972.11. 
Arguments under Pulinsano-If Defendant testifies that he was lying to police may make evidence necessary to case, but given admission not relevant
Court informs parties that issues may be revisited if testimony is given contrary to admission given to law enforcement

Atty Benavides requests clarifications under 948.025(1)E(3) - DA Happ provides clarification of incidents charged
DA Happ addresses Pgh2 of Defense Demand for Discovery - Atty Benavides withdraws request for Pgh2.
Recess: 10:05 am 

NEXT: Case to remain as scheduled
Motion hearing at 08-17-2015 08:30 am

Case called at 1:19 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Mayberto Huesca-Herrera in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Court reviews prior hearing, purpose of today's status and the letter filed by Atty Benavides today, with request to be relieved as counsel
Atty Benavides presents arguments in support of request to withdraw; Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Benavides indicates that he could possibly be prepared for trial if able to meet with client as needed
Court/Counsel discuss remedy re: witness testimony - Court confirms that It did not rule that witnesses would be excluded
Court presents concerns and informs parties that It is satisfied that Mr. Huesca-Herrera is intentionally  attempting to manipulate & delay the proceedings
Atty Benavides indicates that he has not received any names/witnesses previously filed by Defense - DA Happ provides Atty Benavides with 2 copies of 2 witnesses disclosed by Atty Ledesma and 2 pages or report of Det. Caucutt. 
Court presents concerns regarding delay in case, false statements, bond
DA Happ orally motions for the Court to revoke bond and hold him without bond, with return to surety & maybe could use monies for Atty fees
Court denies remedy as requested by State under 969.035(2)(a) and informs parties that It is inclined to set higher cash bond, presents basis
DA Happ informs the Court that State would not object to proposed action of the Court re: bond
Court orders that new deadline for disclosure of defense witnesses to the State is 8/7/15, close of business to include contact information
Atty Benavides presents arguments in opposition of raising cash bond
Court presents basis - denies request to withdraw

Court requires a $40,000 CASH bond, with conditions: 
- No contact with VS (DOB: 2/1/2000) or any member of her immediate family (*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
- Not be alone with any female who is not an adult 
- No physical contact with any female who is not an adult
- Not be physically present at the Watertown High School, but may drop off his brother within a 2 block radius of the high school
- Not be within 100 feet of the complaining witness victim in this case 
- Make self available to Attorney as requested by Attorney

$20,000 cash bond currently posted shall be returned to surety
Court finds that there is no apparent legal or ethical conflict
Recess: 1:57 pm 

NEXT:  Case to remain as scheduled for trial

Case called at 10:45am [mo]
Defendant Mayberto Huesca-Herrera in court with Attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Ledesma submits Defendant's Witness List and Motion for Continuance

The Court and Atty. Ledesma discuss the Transcripts of the 5/7/15 Motion Hearing and 6/9/15 Oral Ruling; specifically Atty. Ledesma claiming Mr. Huesca- Herrera has a U.S. passport.
The Clerk inquires of the Bookkeeper whether the bond money has been returned to the surety; the Bookkeeper indicates that they are awaiting current information of the surety to return the money.

DA Happ requests the $20, 000 bond be reinstated and the $5000 not returned to surety due to a U.S. passport not being relinquished to the Clerk of Courts.
The Court admonishes Atty. Ledesma on giving false facts to the Court.

On the Defendant's Motion for Continuance:
--arguments made by Atty. Ledesma
--The Court denies the Defendants Motion for Continuance due to child victim 


DA Happ indicates that the State is prepared for Trial; Atty. Ledesma indicates besides additional investigation Defense is ready for Trial.
Atty. Ledesma indicates that Mr. Huesca-Herrera requests a Spanish Interpreter for the Trial; thus far Mr. Huesca- Herrera has been able to understand the proceedings with the assistance of Atty. Ledesma explaining legal concepts; further Mr. Huesca- Herrera indicates that he had problems understanding at the Initial Appearance, the Court explains to Mr. Huesca- Herrera what occured at the Initial Appearance. The Court verifies that Mr. Huesca- Herrera has understood all conditions of his bonds. 

The Court orders the $20, 000 cash bond be reinstated, with all previously set conditions (including the no presence at Watertown High School). 
The $5000 will NOT be returned to the surety; the expired Mexican passport is to be returned to Mr. Huesca- Herrera.

Atty. Ledesma is to submit final Witness List to the State by 4:30pm tomorrow(6/17/15)

recess: 11:18am 

NEXT: (1)Continued, FSSC: 6/25/2015 at 11:00am  (2)Jury Trial--6/29/15 at 8:30am  ((arrange Spanish Interpreter for both hearings))
Transcript of oral ruling held on 06-09-15 before the Honorable Judge Koschnick

Case called at 10:40am [mo]
Defendant Mayberto Huesca-Herrera in court with Attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Oral Ruling on Defense's Motion to Suppress Statement//Miranda/Goodchild:

--The Court reviews the 4/9/15 Motion Hearing
--The Court determines that the Mr.Huesca-Herrera was in custody as the Kwik Trip when Detective Caucutt told Mr.Huesca-Herrera he was under arrest and placed handcuffs on him
--The statements were made prior to arrest and therefore, no need for Miranda warnings
--The officer testified that at no time during transport did Mr.Huesca-Herrera ask for an attorney or exercise any other constitutional rights
--Mr.Huesca-Herrera agreed to speak without an attorney and signed Miranda waiver form
--Mr.Huesca-Herrera never refused to answer questions
--Mr.Huesca-Herrera waived Miranda rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently 

Voluntariness:
--No suggestion of involuntariness
--No threats or promises were made by police
--The detective is not trying to manipulate Mr. Huesca-Herrera.

The Court finds that there were no coercive or improper police tactics used and that Mr. Huesca-Herrera personal characteristics are not such that would be especially vulnerable to police tactics
The Court concludes that the State has established both that the Court created Miranda rule was complied with including waiver of Miranda rights by Mr.Huesca-Herrera and that Mr.Huesca-Herrera statement's were given voluntarily.

The Court does not require a written order to be submitted; but if either party would like to do so they may. 

DA Happ indicates that Officer Reitz is unavailable on the Trial date but does not see the need for his testimony; further that all other witnesses are subpoenaed and available.
The Court reviews the deadline to enter a plea with Atty. Ledesma and Mr. Huesca-Herrera
The Court reminds Mr. Huesca-Herrera that his bond and its conditions remain in effect. 
DA Happ indicates that she has filed a Notice to Admit Certified Medical Records
--Atty. Ledesma indicates that he will review the Medical Records 
The Court clarifies that when it modified the bond; it had assumed that Mr. Huesca-Herrera would submit a valid U.S. passport to the Clerk of Courts office; the passport that was relinquished was an invalid Mexican passport. 
---No action taken by DA Happ
recess: 11:00am

NEXT: (1) FSSC: 6/16/15 at 10:30am (2) Jury Trial: 6/29/15 at 8:30am ((already scheduled))

Case called at 1:29 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Mayberto Huesca-Herrera appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Huesca-Herrera is eligible for SPD Services
